page.title: 01 HATFIELD AND DISTRICT
page.content: Our D-block covers the Hatfield & Dunscoft area.Hatfield the largest settlement,is a dormitory village of Doncaster, which is 8-9 miles away.It is mentioned in the original Domesday Book,and for hundreds of years it was like {"an island surrounded by {marshland"}.The marsh has been drained, but even so, Hatfield hasn't lost all of its medieval buildings and scenery eg,the Manor and church situated next to the High Street. The area is flat and land use is dominated by crops,although earlier use icluded a large royal hunting ground (Hatfield Chase) Coal Mining is a major source of employment in our area,Hatfield Main Colliery being situated on the border of our D-Block.Many people are recovering from the ravages of the longest ever coal strike.(1984-5).
